name: abolitionist
trans: n. 废奴主义者；废除主义者

name: emancipator
trans: n. 释放者；解放者

sentences.english: After his son's death, Lincoln decided that one of his purposes was to be an emancipator -- to begin the process of freeing the slaves. A few months later, he wrote the Emancipation Proclamation.
sentences.chinese: 在他儿子去逝后，林肯确定他的一个目标就是要成为一名解放者----推动奴隶自由的进程，几个月后，他起草了《解放宣言》。

name: equality
trans: n. 平等；相等；[数] 等式

sentences.english: ...equality of the sexes.
sentences.chinese: …性别平等。

detailed_translations.chinese: 等同； 平等； 相等
detailed_translations.english: a situation in which people have the same rights, advantages etc

name: orator
trans: n. 演说者；演讲者；雄辩家；原告

sentences.english: He was a natural politician, a gifted orator who knew how to work a crowd.
sentences.chinese: 他曾是位天生的政治家，是位有天赋且知道如何凝集民众的演说家。

detailed_translations.chinese: 演说者；演讲者；雄辩家；原告
detailed_translations.english: someone who is good at making speeches and persuading people

name: secede
trans: vi. 脱离；退出 vt. 从…中脱离；割让

sentences.english: Singapore seceded from the Federation of Malaysia and became an independent sovereign state.
sentences.chinese: 新加坡脱离马来西亚联邦成为一个独立的主权国家。

detailed_translations.english: if a country or state secedes from another country, it officially stops being part of it and becomes independent

name: agitation
trans: n. 激动；搅动；煽动；烦乱

sentences.english: mass agitation for political reform
sentences.chinese: 要求政治改革的大骚动

detailed_translations.english: public argument or action for social or political change

name: bequeath
trans: vt. 遗赠；把…遗赠给；把…传下去

sentences.english: He bequeathed all his silver to his children.
sentences.chinese: 他把所有的银币都留给了他的孩子们。

detailed_translations.chinese: 遗赠；把…遗赠给；把…传下去
detailed_translations.english: to officially arrange for someone to have something that you own after your death

name: deduction
trans: n. 扣除，减除；推论；减除额

sentences.english: Children will soon make deductions about the meaning of a word.
sentences.chinese: 儿童不久就能推断词义了。

detailed_translations.english: the process of using the knowledge or information you have in order to understand something or form an opinion, or the opinion that you form

name: estate
trans: n. 房地产；财产；身份

sentences.english: a country estate
sentences.chinese: 乡村的庄园

detailed_translations.chinese: 土地， 住宅区， 地产； 财产， 遗产； 庄园， 种植园
detailed_translations.english: a large area of land in the country, usually with one large house on it and one owner

name: intuition
trans: n. 直觉；直觉力；直觉的知识

sentences.english: feminine intuition
sentences.chinese: 女性的直觉

sentences.english: Intuition told her it was unwise to argue.
sentences.chinese: 直觉告诉她争吵是不理智的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 直觉； 由直觉获知的信息
detailed_translations.english: the ability to understand or know something because of a feeling rather than by considering the facts

name: mania
trans: n. 狂热；狂躁；热衷 n. (Mania)人名；(罗、阿拉伯、西)马尼亚

sentences.english: The mania for dinosaurs began in the late 1800s.
sentences.chinese: 恐龙热兴起于19世纪晚期。

detailed_translations.chinese: [医]颠狂, 狂躁, 癖好, 狂热
detailed_translations.english: a strong desire for something or interest in something, especially one that affects a lot of people at the same time

name: examine
trans: vt. 检查；调查； 检测；考试 vi. 检查；调查

sentences.english: A team of divers was sent down to examine the wreck.
sentences.chinese: 一组潜水员被送到水下检查沉船。

sentences.english: Hegel’s philosophy will be examined in detail in Chapter 4.
sentences.chinese: 黑格尔的哲学将在第4章作详细探讨。

detailed_translations.english: to look at something carefully and thoroughly because you want to find out more about it

name: herald
trans: v. 预示……的来临；宣布，通报；公开称赞 n. 预兆，征兆；（古）传令官，报信者；先驱；棘翅夜蛾 n. (Herald) （美、英、印度）赫勒尔德（人名）

sentences.english: A flash of lightning heralded torrential rain.
sentences.chinese: 一道闪电预示着暴雨即将来临。

sentences.english: Flashing blue lights heralded the arrival of the police.
sentences.chinese: 闪烁的蓝色灯光预示警察就要到达。

sentences.english: I welcome the report as a herald of more freedom.
sentences.chinese: 我欢迎这份报告，认为它预示着更多的自由。

detailed_translations.english: to be a sign of something that is going to come or happen soon

detailed_translations.chinese: 信使； 预示， 预兆
detailed_translations.english: Something that is a herald of a future event or situation is a sign that it is going to happen or appear

name: meddler
trans: n. 干涉者；爱管闲事的人

sentences.english: I know you, you scoundrel! I have heard of you before. You are Holmes, the meddler.
sentences.chinese: 我知道你，这个恶棍。我以前听过你。你是福尔摩斯，爱管闲事的人。

name: nocturnal
trans: adj. 夜的；夜曲的；夜间发生的

sentences.english: Hamsters are nocturnal creatures.
sentences.chinese: 仓鼠是夜行动物。

detailed_translations.chinese: 夜的；夜曲的；夜间发生的
detailed_translations.english: an animal that is nocturnal is active at night

name: perplexity
trans: n. 困惑；混乱

sentences.english: moral perplexities
sentences.chinese: 道德难题

detailed_translations.chinese: (正式用语)困惑，窘困，令人困惑的事或物
detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being confused or worried by something you cannot understand

name: sinister
trans: adj. 阴险的；凶兆的；灾难性的；左边的

sentences.english: There is a sinister side to these events.
sentences.chinese: 这些事件有邪恶的一面。

sentences.english: He was a handsome man, in a sinister sort of way.
sentences.chinese: 他英俊的外貌中带着一点阴险。

sentences.english: a sinister atmosphere
sentences.chinese: 不祥的气氛

detailed_translations.chinese: 阴险的；凶兆的；灾难性的；左边的
detailed_translations.english: making you feel that something evil, dangerous, or illegal is happening or will happen

name: erroneous
trans: adj. 错误的；不正确的

sentences.english: His economic predictions are based on some erroneous assumptions.
sentences.chinese: 他的经济预测是基于错误假设之上的。

detailed_translations.english: erroneous ideas or information are wrong and based on facts that are not correct

name: rouse
trans: vt. 唤醒；激起，使振奋；惊起 vi. 醒来；奋起 n. 觉醒；奋起 n. (Rouse)人名；(英)劳斯

sentences.english: His banging roused the neighbours.
sentences.chinese: 他重重的关门声把邻居都吵醒了。

detailed_translations.english: to wake someone who is sleeping deeply

name: schemer
trans: n. 阴谋家；谋士；计划者

name: serpent
trans: n. 蛇（尤指大蛇或毒蛇）；狡猾的人

sentences.english: ...the serpent in the Garden of Eden.
sentences.chinese: …伊甸园里的那条蛇。

detailed_translations.english: a snake, especially a large one

name: ventilator
trans: n. 通风设备；换气扇；【医】呼吸机

sentences.english: Scientists in Melbourne, Australia, used a ventilator and pump to keep the animal lungs alive and "breathing" while human blood flowed in them.
sentences.chinese: 澳大利亚墨尔本的科学家们让人的血液流过动物的肺，并用换气扇和打气筒帮助动物的肺存活并“呼吸”。

detailed_translations.chinese: 通风设备；换气扇；【医】呼吸机
detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that puts fresh air into a room, building etc

name: vigil
trans: n. 守夜；监视；不眠；警戒 n. (Vigil)人名；(西)比希尔

sentences.english: Eva and Paul kept a constant vigil by their daughter’s hospital bedside.
sentences.chinese: 伊娃和保罗一直在医院里守在女儿的病床边。

detailed_translations.english: a period of time, especially during the night, when you stay awake in order to pray, remain with someone who is ill, or watch for danger

name: ambitious
trans: adj. 野心勃勃的；有雄心的；热望的；炫耀的

sentences.english: Alfred was intensely ambitious, obsessed with the idea of becoming rich.
sentences.chinese: 艾尔弗雷德雄心勃勃，一心想着发财。

detailed_translations.english: determined to be successful, rich, powerful etc

name: cavalry
trans: n. 骑兵；装甲兵；装甲部队

sentences.english: The Black Prince led a cavalry charge against them.
sentences.chinese: 黑王子带领骑兵向他们冲去。

detailed_translations.english: the part of an army that fights on horses, especially in the past

name: city-state
trans: n. 城邦

name: fleet
trans: n. 船队，舰队；捕鱼船队；（一国的）海军；（同一机构的）车队，机群；（沼泽地）小河，水道，沟 adj. 快速的，敏捷的；跑得快的，疾驰的；（水）浅的 adv. （水）浅，不深地 v. （诗歌或文学）飞逝，疾驰；消磨，使（时间）飞快地过去；消失，转瞬即逝 n. (Fleet) （美）弗利特（人名）

sentences.english: Atalanta was fleet of foot (= able to run quickly ) .
sentences.chinese: 阿塔兰特跑起来很快。

detailed_translations.english: fast or quick
a group of ships, or all the ships in a navy

name: infantry
trans: n. 步兵；步兵团

sentences.english: an infantry regiment
sentences.chinese: 步兵团

detailed_translations.english: soldiers who fight on foot

name: regent
trans: n. 摄政王；摄政者；州立大学董事会董事；统治者 adj. 摄政的；统治的 n. (Regent)人名；(英)雷金特；(捷)雷根特；(法)勒让

detailed_translations.chinese: 摄政王；摄政者；州立大学董事会董事；统治者
detailed_translations.english: someone who governs instead of a king or queen, because the king or queen is ill, absent, or still a child

name: accomplice
trans: n. 同谋者，[法] 共犯

sentences.english: Witnesses said the gunman immediately ran to a motorcycle being ridden by an accomplice.
sentences.chinese: 证人们说该枪手立即向由一名同犯驾驶的摩托车跑去。

detailed_translations.english: a person who helps someone such as a criminal to do something wrong

name: destitute
trans: adj. 穷困的；无的；缺乏的 n. 赤贫者 vt. 使穷困；夺去

sentences.english: The floods left many people destitute .
sentences.chinese: 这场洪水使许多人变得一无所有。

detailed_translations.english: having no money, no food, no home etc

name: flabbergasted
trans: adj. 目瞪口呆的，大吃一惊的 v. 使……大吃一惊（flabbergast 的过去式和过去分词）

name: prosperous
trans: adj. 繁荣的；兴旺的

sentences.english: a prosperous landowner
sentences.chinese: 富裕的土地拥有者

detailed_translations.english: rich and successful

name: unscrupulous
trans: adj. 肆无忌惮的；寡廉鲜耻的；不讲道德的

sentences.english: unscrupulous employers
sentences.chinese: 无耻的雇主

detailed_translations.chinese: 肆无忌惮的；寡廉鲜耻的；不讲道德的
detailed_translations.english: behaving in an unfair or dishonest way

name: annihilation
trans: n. 毁灭；溃败；（物理）湮灭，湮没

sentences.english: That is because Hamas is a terrorist organisation. Its founding charter claims the Holy Land exclusively for Islam and calls for the complete annihilation of Israel.
sentences.chinese: 这是因为哈马斯是一个恐怖组织，它的成立宪章中宣称加沙是伊斯兰独一无二的圣地，号召完全消灭以色列。

name: brainwash
trans: v. 对……洗脑，以宣传说服 n. 洗脑

sentences.english: They brainwash people into giving up all their money.
sentences.chinese: 他们给人们洗脑,使他们放弃他们所有的钱。

detailed_translations.english: If you brainwash someone, you force them to believe something by continually telling them that it is true, and preventing them from thinking about it properly

name: collaborate
trans: vi. 合作；勾结，通敌

sentences.english: Much later he collaborated with his son Michael on the English translation of a text on food production.
sentences.chinese: 后来他和儿子迈克尔合作，把一个有关食品生产的文本翻译成英语。

detailed_translations.english: to work together with a person or group in order to achieve something, especially in science or art

name: colonization
trans: n. 殖民；殖民地化

sentences.english: What is the process of colonization?
sentences.chinese: 殖民地化的过程又是怎样？

sentences.english: They have known colonization, revolution and emigration.
sentences.chinese: 他们了解殖民、革命还有移民。

sentences.english: We also substituted “settlement” for “colonization” in the title of the book.
sentences.chinese: 本书标题中原先使用的“殖民”一词，也用“移民”代替。

name: invasion
trans: n. 入侵，侵略；侵袭；侵犯

sentences.english: the invasion of Normandy
sentences.chinese: 对诺曼底的入侵

detailed_translations.english: when the army of one country enters another country by force, in order to take control of it

name: submit
trans: vt. 使服从；主张；呈递；提交 vi. 服从，顺从

sentences.english: In desperation, Mrs. Jones submitted to an operation on her right knee to relieve the pain.
sentences.chinese: 绝望中，琼斯夫人不得已接受了一次她右膝的手术以减轻疼痛。

detailed_translations.chinese: 屈从， 听从； 忍受； 甘心
detailed_translations.english: If you submit to something, you unwillingly allow something to be done to you, or you do what someone wants, for example because you are not powerful enough to resist

detailed_translations.chinese: 屈从，听从，服从；呈送，提交；主张，建议
detailed_translations.english: to give a plan, piece of writing etc to someone in authority for them to consider or approve

name: breakthrough
trans: n. 突破；突破性进展

sentences.english: The company looks poised to make a significant breakthrough in China.
sentences.chinese: 该公司看上去稳将在中国实现一次重大突破。

detailed_translations.english: an important new discovery in something you are studying, especially one made after trying for a long time

name: consumption
trans: n. 消费；消耗；肺痨

sentences.english: Vigorous exercise increases oxygen consumption.
sentences.chinese: 剧烈运动增加氧的消耗。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of energy, oil, electricity etc that is used

name: habitable
trans: adj. 可居住的；适于居住的

sentences.english: It would cost a fortune to make the place habitable.
sentences.chinese: 要想让这个地方可以住人得花一大笔钱。

detailed_translations.english: good enough for people to live in

name: perspective
trans: n. 观点；远景；透视图 adj. 透视的

sentences.english: the artist’s use of perspective
sentences.chinese: 那位画家对透视法的运用

sentences.english: a perspective of the whole valley
sentences.chinese: 山谷全景

sentences.english: His father’s death gave him a whole new perspective on life.
sentences.chinese: 父亲的死使他对生活有了全新的看法。

detailed_translations.english: a method of drawing a picture that makes objects look solid and shows distance and depth, or the effect this method produces in a picture

name: technology
trans: n. 技术；工艺；术语

sentences.english: Modern technology makes moving money around much easier than it used to be.
sentences.chinese: 现代科技使货币流动比以前便捷得多。

sentences.english: Advances in technology have improved crop yields by over 30%.
sentences.chinese: 科技的进步使庄稼产量提高了30%以上。

sentences.english: There have been major new developments in satellite technology.
sentences.chinese: 卫星技术有了重大的新发展。

sentences.english: Many people are unwilling to embrace new technologies.
sentences.chinese: 很多人不愿意接受新科技。

detailed_translations.chinese: 工艺学； 工艺， 技术
detailed_translations.english: new machines, equipment, and ways of doing things that are based on modern knowledge about science and computers

name: transition
trans: n. 过渡；转变；[分子生物] 转换；变调

sentences.english: Making the transition from youth to adulthood can be very painful.
sentences.chinese: 从青少年过渡到成年有时是一个非常痛苦的过程。

sentences.english: a society that is in transition
sentences.chinese: 一个正在转型的社会

sentences.english: the period of transition to full democracy
sentences.chinese: 向全面民主的过渡时期

detailed_translations.english: when something changes from one form or state to another

name: collaborator
trans: n. [劳经] 合作者；勾结者；通敌者

sentences.english: collaborators on a biography of Dickens
sentences.chinese: 狄更斯传记的合著者

detailed_translations.english: someone who works with other people or groups in order to achieve something, especially in science or art

name: compatible
trans: adj. 兼容的；能共处的；可并立的

sentences.english: The new software is IBM compatible (= can be used with IBM computers ) .
sentences.chinese: 这个新软件与IBM的计算机兼容。

detailed_translations.english: if two pieces of computer equipment are compatible, they can be used together, especially when they are made by different companies

name: intervene
trans: vi. 干涉；调停；插入

sentences.english: The army will have to intervene to prevent further fighting.
sentences.chinese: 军队将不得不干预以阻止进一步的战斗。

sentences.english: The police don’t usually like to intervene in disputes between husbands and wives.
sentences.chinese: 警方通常不愿意介入夫妻之间的争吵。

detailed_translations.english: to become involved in an argument, fight, or other difficult situation in order to change what happens

name: cerebrum
trans: n. [解剖] 大脑

name: decipher
trans: v. 破译，译解；辨认，解释，理解 n. 密电（或密信的）译文

sentences.english: She studied the envelope, trying to decipher the handwriting.
sentences.chinese: 她仔细地看信封，试图辨认上面的字迹。

detailed_translations.chinese: 解释（过去式deciphered，过去分词deciphered，现在分词deciphering，第三人称单数deciphers，名词decipherer，形容词decipherable）；译解
detailed_translations.english: to find the meaning of something that is difficult to read or understand

name: hemisphere
trans: n. 半球

sentences.english: the Northern hemisphere
sentences.chinese: 北半球

detailed_translations.english: a half of the Earth, especially one of the halves above and below the equator

name: lobe
trans: n. （脑、肺等的）叶；裂片；耳垂；波瓣 n. (Lobe)人名；(西)洛韦；(德、喀)洛贝

sentences.english: ...damage to the temporal lobe of the brain.
sentences.chinese: ...对大脑颞叶的损伤。

detailed_translations.english: the soft piece of flesh at the bottom of your ear

name: neuron
trans: n. [解剖] 神经元，神经单位

sentences.english: A neuron has only one axon.
sentences.chinese: 一个神经元只有一个轴突。

sentences.english: Between any neurons, between the axon of one neuron and the dendrite of another, there's a tiny gap.
sentences.chinese: 在神经元之间，在一个神经元的轴突，和另一个神经元的树突之间，有一个细小的缝隙。

sentences.english: But they don't know exactly what goes into that neuron to store the memory, or how to dissolve that synaptic connection if you want to forget something.
sentences.chinese: 但是他们不十分准确的了解存储记忆的时候是什么被带进了神经元，如果你想要忘记某些事情，有如何让连接的触突解散。

detailed_translations.english: a type of cell that makes up the nervous system and sends messages to other parts of the body or the brain

name: photosynthesis
trans: n. 光合作用

sentences.english: It has at least one gene necessary for photosynthesis—so far it’s the only animal known with this ability.
sentences.chinese: 它有至少一个基因是光合作用所必需的——到目前为止这是唯一被发现具有此项能力的动物。

sentences.english: The belt of vegetation that crosses Africa below the Sahara is very dark because most of the sunlight is absorbed by plants for photosynthesis.
sentences.chinese: 在撒哈拉沙漠下方，横贯非洲中部的植被带颜色非常深，因为植物由于光合作用吸收了大多数太阳光。

sentences.english: As the ocean warms, it becomes more stratified, with the warmer water remaining at the top where the organisms need to be in order to do photosynthesis.
sentences.chinese: 但是随着海水变暖，它的层次会更加分明，温度更高的海水会停留在表面，而这里正是生物体进行光合作用必需的地方。

detailed_translations.english: the production by a green plant of special substances like sugar that it uses as food, caused by the action of sunlight on  chlorophyll (= the green substance in leaves )

name: phytoplankton
trans: n. [植] 浮游植物（群落）

name: agribusiness
trans: n. 农业综合企业（包括农业设备、用品的制造、农产品的产销、制造加工等）

name: fertilizer
trans: n. [肥料] 肥料；受精媒介物；促进发展者

sentences.english: ...farming without any purchased chemical, fertilizer or pesticide.
sentences.chinese: …不使用任何购买的化学品、肥料或杀虫剂的耕作。

sentences.english: The tolerance he that old daddy take into to my bug munificence have gets the man sort.
sentences.chinese: 老爸对我的错误加以宽容，他有着男人般的宽宏大量。

detailed_translations.chinese: 慷慨给予， 宽宏大量

name: incredulous
trans: adj. 怀疑的；不轻信的

sentences.english: ‘You sold the car?’ she asked, incredulous.
sentences.chinese: “你把车卖了？”她难以置信地问道。

detailed_translations.english: unable or unwilling to believe something

name: lamentation
trans: n. 悲痛，悲叹

name: penance
trans: n. 忏悔；苦修；苦差事 v. 使忏悔；使苦修

name: remorse
trans: n. 懊悔；同情

sentences.english: Throughout the trial, he had shown no remorse .
sentences.chinese: 整个审判过程中，他没有表示出一丝悔意。

detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling of being sorry that you have done something very bad

name: specter
trans: n. 幽灵；妖怪；恐怖之物

name: wretched
trans: adj. 可怜的；卑鄙的；令人苦恼或难受的

sentences.english: the poor, wretched girl
sentences.chinese: 极其不幸的可怜姑娘

detailed_translations.english: someone who is wretched is very unhappy or ill, and you feel sorry for them

name: condescension
trans: n. 谦虚；屈尊；傲慢态度；纡尊降贵[表不满]

sentences.english: There was a tinge of condescension in her greeting.
sentences.chinese: 她的问候中有些许的纡尊降贵。

detailed_translations.english: Condescension is condescending behaviour

name: diminish
trans: vt. 使减少；使变小 vi. 减少，缩小；变小

sentences.english: The party’s share of the electorate has diminished steadily.
sentences.chinese: 支持这个政党的选民比例持续下降。

sentences.english: These drugs diminish blood flow to the brain.
sentences.chinese: 这些药物会减少流向脑部的血液量。

detailed_translations.english: to become or make something become smaller or less

detailed_translations.chinese: 减少， 减小， 降低
detailed_translations.english: to become or make something become smaller or less

name: lustrous
trans: adj. 有光泽的；光辉的

sentences.english: Her hair was beautifully dark and lustrous.
sentences.chinese: 她的秀发乌黑光亮。

detailed_translations.english: shining in a soft gentle way

name: neglected
trans: adj. 被忽视的；无人照管的 v. 疏于照顾；忽视；疏忽（neglect 的过去式和过去分词）

sentences.english: He'd given too much to his career, worked long hours, neglected her.
sentences.chinese: 他在事业上投入太多了，长时间地工作，冷落了她。

detailed_translations.chinese: 被忽视的；未被好好照管的

detailed_translations.english: If you neglect someone or something, you fail to give them the amount of attention that they deserve

name: resolve
trans: vt. 决定；溶解；使…分解；决心要做… vi. 解决；决心；分解 n. 坚决；决定要做的事

sentences.english: Barnet was desperate for money to resolve his financial problems.
sentences.chinese: 巴尼特急需钱来解决他的经济问题。

sentences.english: After the divorce she resolved never to marry again.
sentences.chinese: 离婚以后，她决心永不再嫁。

sentences.english: Recent events strengthened her resolve to find out the truth.
sentences.chinese: 最近发生的事件坚定了她找出真相的决心。

detailed_translations.english: to find a satisfactory way of dealing with a problem or difficulty
strong determination to succeed in doing something

name: welfare
trans: n. 福利；幸福；福利事业；安宁 adj. 福利的；接受社会救济的

sentences.english: Our only concern is the children’s welfare.
sentences.chinese: 我们唯一关心的是孩子们的幸福。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s welfare is their health and happiness

name: apprentice
trans: n. 学徒；生手 vt. 使…当学徒 vi. 当学徒

sentences.english: The apprentice lingered his work.
sentences.chinese: 这个徒弟磨洋工。

sentences.english: His apprentice always leaves the tools about.
sentences.chinese: 他的徒弟老是乱放工具。

sentences.english: That would be good for my apprentice to have, complementary.
sentences.chinese: 补充说一下，那会是成为我徒弟的优势。

name: avarice
trans: n. 贪婪，贪财

sentences.english: He paid a month's rent in advance, just enough to satisfy the landlord's avarice.
sentences.chinese: 他预交了一个月的房租，正好满足了房东的贪心。

detailed_translations.english: a desire to have a lot of money that is considered to be too strong

name: domestic
trans: adj. 国内的；家庭的；驯养的；一心只管家务的 n. 国货；佣人

sentences.english: ...over 100 domestic flights a day to 30 leading U.S. destinations.
sentences.chinese: …每天飞往美国30个主要目的地的100多个国内航班。

detailed_translations.english: relating to or happening in one particular country and not involving any other countries

name: principle
trans: n. 原理，原则；主义，道义；本质，本义；根源，源泉

sentences.english: Schools try to teach children a set of principles.
sentences.chinese: 学校设法教给孩子们一套道德准则。

sentences.english: He’s got no principles at all!
sentences.chinese: 他毫无道德准则！

sentences.english: It’s against my principles to accept gifts from clients.
sentences.chinese: 收受客户礼物违背我的原则。

detailed_translations.english: a moral rule or belief about what is right and wrong, that influences how you behave

name: reproach
trans: n. 责备；耻辱 vt. 责备；申斥

sentences.english: ‘You don’t need me,’ she said quietly, without reproach.
sentences.chinese: “你不需要我。”她语气平静，没有丝毫责备。

detailed_translations.english: criticism, blame, or disapproval

name: dogged
trans: adj. 顽强的；顽固的 vt. 跟踪；尾随（dog的过去式）

sentences.english: a dogged determination to succeed
sentences.chinese: 不屈不挠的成功决心

detailed_translations.english: dogged behaviour shows that you are very determined to continue doing something

name: facetious
trans: adj. 诙谐的；爱开玩笑的；滑稽的；(尤指在不合适的时候)开玩笑的

sentences.english: Don’t be so facetious!
sentences.chinese: 别这么乱开玩笑！

sentences.english: facetious comments
sentences.chinese: 不当的戏谑评论

detailed_translations.chinese: 诙谐的；爱开玩笑的；滑稽的；(尤指在不合适的时候)开玩笑的
detailed_translations.english: saying things that are intended to be clever and funny but are really silly and annoying

name: genial
trans: adj. 亲切的，友好的；和蔼的；适宜的

sentences.english: a genial smile
sentences.chinese: 亲切的微笑

detailed_translations.chinese: 亲切的，友好的；和蔼的；适宜的
detailed_translations.english: friendly and happy

name: opulence
trans: n. 富裕；丰富

sentences.english: They have concentrated on a opulence life style and realize thepoor working man who has seen very little benefit from the sale of oil is notgoing to come to their rescue.
sentences.chinese: 他们现在过着富裕的生活，并意识到那些从石油销售中没有获得多少好处的贫穷工人是不会来拯救他们的。

sentences.english: We believe our clients are more sophisticated they believe in a lifestyle of improved working environment, we believe this means opulence is not sufficient and more tools will be required.
sentences.chinese: 我们认为客户更复杂，他们信仰改善工作环境的生活方式，我们认为这意味空间的富裕是不够的，需要更多的工具。

name: bustle
trans: v. 四下忙碌；使（人沿某方向）匆忙地走；繁忙 n. 喧闹；（旧时女子用的）裙撑

sentences.english: My mother bustled around the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 我母亲在厨房里忙得团团转。

detailed_translations.english: to move around quickly, looking very busy

detailed_translations.chinese: 喧闹；活跃；裙撑；热闹的活动
detailed_translations.english: busy and usually noisy activity

name: credulity
trans: n. 轻信；易受骗

sentences.english: Advertisers were accused of exploiting consumers’ credulity.
sentences.chinese: 广告商被指责利用了客户对他们的轻信。

detailed_translations.english: willingness or ability to believe that something is true

name: exult
trans: vi. 狂喜，欢欣鼓舞；非常高兴

sentences.english: ‘We made the front page!’ Jos exulted.
sentences.chinese: “我们上了头版！”乔斯欣喜若狂道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 狂喜，欢欣鼓舞；非常高兴
detailed_translations.english: to show that you are very happy and proud, especially because you have succeeded in doing something

name: odious
trans: adj. 可憎的；讨厌的

sentences.english: an odious little man
sentences.chinese: 讨厌的小男人

detailed_translations.english: extremely unpleasant

name: officious
trans: adj. 摆官架子的；爱管闲事的；乐于助人的

sentences.english: an officious traffic warden
sentences.chinese: 一名爱发号施令的交通督导员

detailed_translations.chinese: 爱发号施令的， 爱指手画脚的
detailed_translations.english: too eager to tell people what to do – used to show disapproval

name: penitence
trans: n. 后悔；赎罪

name: abject
trans: adj. 卑鄙的；可怜的；不幸的；（境况）凄惨的，绝望的

sentences.english: an abject apology
sentences.chinese: 低声下气的道歉

detailed_translations.chinese: 卑鄙的；可怜的；不幸的；（境况）凄惨的，绝望的

name: consequence
trans: n. 结果；重要性；推论

sentences.english: Her lawyer said she understood the consequences of her actions and was prepared to go to jail.
sentences.chinese: 她的律师说她明白自己行为的后果并准备去坐牢。

detailed_translations.english: something that happens as a result of a particular action or set of conditions

name: degradation
trans: n. 退化；降格，降级；堕落

sentences.english: ...air pollution, traffic congestion, and the steady degradation of our quality of life.
sentences.chinese: …空气污染、交通阻塞以及我们生活质量的持续恶化。

detailed_translations.english: the process by which something changes to a worse condition

name: ignorance
trans: n. 无知，愚昧；不知，不懂

sentences.english: Excuse my ignorance, but how does it actually work?
sentences.chinese: 请原谅我的无知，它究竟是如何运作的？

detailed_translations.english: lack of knowledge or information about something

name: prostrate
trans: adj. 俯卧的；拜倒的；降伏的；沮丧的 vt. 使…屈服；将…弄倒；使…俯伏

sentences.english: They found him lying prostrate on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 他们发现他趴在地板上。

sentences.english: They prostrated themselves before their king.
sentences.chinese: 他们向他们的国王跪拜行礼。

detailed_translations.chinese: 俯卧的；拜倒的；降伏的；沮丧的
detailed_translations.english: lying on your front with your face towards the ground
If you prostrate yourself, you lie down flat on the ground, on your front, usually to show respect for God or a person in authority

name: want
trans: vt. 需要；希望；应该；缺少 n. 需要；缺乏；贫困；必需品 vi. 需要；缺少

sentences.english: She spent her life pandering to the wants of her children.
sentences.chinese: 她一生都在设法满足子女的需要。

sentences.english: The gallery closed down for want of funding.
sentences.chinese: 那家画廊由于缺乏资金关闭了。

detailed_translations.english: something that you need or want

name: dumb
trans: adj. 哑的，无说话能力的；不说话的，无声音的

sentences.english: What a dumb question.
sentences.chinese: 多么愚蠢的问题。

sentences.english: a bunch of dumb kids
sentences.chinese: 一帮笨孩子

sentences.english: ‘What is it?’ I asked, playing dumb (= pretending to be stupid ) .
sentences.chinese: “那是什么？” 我装傻问道。

sentences.english: She’s no dumb blonde (= a pretty woman with blonde hair who seems stupid ) .
sentences.chinese: 她可不是那种没有头脑的金发女郎。

detailed_translations.chinese: 哑的；暂不说话的；愚笨的
detailed_translations.english: stupid

name: flaunt
trans: vt. 炫耀；飘扬 vi. 飘扬；夸耀 n. 炫耀；飘扬；招展

sentences.english: The rich flaunted their wealth while the poor starved on the streets.
sentences.chinese: 富人摆阔，穷人却在大街上饿肚子。

detailed_translations.english: to show your money, success, beauty etc so that other people notice it – used to show disapproval

name: plunder
trans: v. 掠夺，抢劫；侵吞，剽窃；将……滥用殆尽 n. 抢夺；战利品；掠夺品

sentences.english: Henry’s army returned loaded down with plunder.
sentences.chinese: 亨利的部队满载战利品而归。

detailed_translations.english: things that have been stolen during a violent attack, especially during a war
to steal large amounts of money or property from somewhere, especially while fighting in a war

name: recoil
trans: vi. 畏缩；弹回；报应 n. 畏缩；弹回；反作用

sentences.english: We recoil in horror from the thought of subjecting someone to extreme pain.
sentences.chinese: 想到要让一个人经受极度的痛苦，我们就会恐惧地退缩。

sentences.english: ...his small body jerking in recoil from the volume of his shouting.
sentences.chinese: …他小小身体在他大声的叫喊中畏缩地抽搐着。

detailed_translations.english: to move back suddenly and quickly from something you do not like or are afraid of
Recoil is also a noun

name: shroud
trans: n. 寿衣；覆盖物；船的横桅索；[电] 护罩 vt. 覆盖；包以尸衣

sentences.english: The fog rolled in, and a grey shroud covered the city.
sentences.chinese: 大雾滚滚而来，一张灰色的天幕笼罩着这个城市。

detailed_translations.chinese: 寿衣；覆盖物；船的横桅索；[电] 护罩
detailed_translations.english: a cloth that is wrapped around a dead person’s body before it is buried
to cover or hide something

name: bereft
trans: adj. 丧失的；被剥夺的；失去亲人的 v. 失去…的（bereave的过去式）

sentences.english: The place seemed to be utterly bereft of human life.
sentences.chinese: 看起来，这地方人迹罕至。

detailed_translations.chinese: 丧失的；被剥夺的；失去亲人的
detailed_translations.english: If a person or thing is bereft of something, they no longer have it

name: beseech
trans: vt. 恳求，哀求；乞求，急切地要求得到

sentences.english: She beseeched him to cut out his drinking and his smoking.
sentences.chinese: 她央求他戒酒戒烟。

detailed_translations.chinese: 恳求，哀求；乞求，急切地要求得到
detailed_translations.english: to eagerly and anxiously ask someone for something

name: grieve
trans: vt. 使悲伤，使苦恼 vi. 悲痛，哀悼 n. (Grieve)人名；(英)格里夫

sentences.english: People need time to grieve after the death of a loved one.
sentences.chinese: 人们在所爱之人去世后会有一段悲伤期。

sentences.english: She grieved the loss of her only son.
sentences.chinese: 她因为失去唯一的儿子而悲痛。

detailed_translations.english: to feel extremely sad, especially because someone you love has died
if something grieves you, it makes you feel very unhappy

name: merciless
trans: adj. 残忍的；无慈悲心的

sentences.english: a merciless attack
sentences.chinese: 无情的攻击

sentences.english: a merciless killer
sentences.chinese: 残忍的杀手

detailed_translations.english: cruel and showing no kindness or forgiveness

name: relent
trans: vi. 变温和，变宽厚；减弱；缓和 vt. 使变温和；减轻 v. 再借给（relend的过去分词）

sentences.english: At last her father relented and came to visit her.
sentences.chinese: 最后她父亲的态度软化，去看了她。

detailed_translations.chinese: 变温和，变宽厚；减弱；缓和
detailed_translations.english: to change your attitude and become less strict or cruel towards someone

name: convention
trans: n. 大会；[法] 惯例；[计] 约定；[法] 协定；习俗

sentences.english: a teachers’ convention
sentences.chinese: 教师大会

sentences.english: the city’s new convention center
sentences.chinese: 该市新建的会议中心

sentences.english: a convention for science fiction fans
sentences.chinese: 科幻小说迷的集会

detailed_translations.english: a large formal meeting for people who belong to the same profession or organization or who have the same interests

name: diversity
trans: n. 多样性；差异

sentences.english: ...the cultural diversity of Latin America.
sentences.chinese: …拉丁美洲文化的多样性。

detailed_translations.english: the fact of including many different types of people or things

name: merchandise
trans: n. 商品；货物 vt. 买卖；推销 vi. 经商

sentences.english: A range of official Disney merchandise was on sale.
sentences.chinese: 一系列正版的迪士尼商品在出售。

sentences.english: They inspected the merchandise carefully.
sentences.chinese: 他们仔细地检查了商品。

detailed_translations.english: goods that are being sold
to try to sell goods or services using methods such as advertising

name: panel
trans: n. 仪表板；嵌板；座谈小组，全体陪审员 vt. 嵌镶板 n. (Panel) 帕内尔（人名）

sentences.english: A panel of experts has looked at the proposal.
sentences.chinese: 一组专家审核了那项提议。

sentences.english: There will be at least three senior doctors on the panel.
sentences.chinese: 专家小组中至少有三名资深医生。

detailed_translations.english: a group of people with skills or specialist knowledge who have been chosen to give advice or opinions on a particular subject

name: venue
trans: n. 聚会地点；举行场所；犯罪地点；发生地点；（英格兰律）审判地（指郡或区）

sentences.english: The first thing to do is book a venue.
sentences.chinese: 首先要做的是预订一个会场。

sentences.english: The band will play (= perform at ) as many venues as possible.
sentences.chinese: 那支乐队将在尽可能多的地方演出。

detailed_translations.english: a place where an organized meeting, concert etc takes place

name: Allies
trans: n. （第二次世界大战时的）同盟国；（第一次世界大战时的）协约国

name: casualty
trans: n. 意外事故；伤亡人员；急诊室

sentences.english: We have had our first casualty. One runner has dropped out with cramp.
sentences.chinese: 我们有了第一位伤员，有一位队员因腿部痉挛退出了。

sentences.english: Any history of bombing must also be a history of civilian casualty, for bombing saves the lives of soldiers only at the expense of other lives.
sentences.chinese: 任何空袭的历史也必定是平民伤亡的历史，因为空袭救了士兵的性命只能以其他人的生命为代价。

sentences.english: The first item always on that was the overnight casualty report from Iraq and Afghanistan, and I would often come and see that had been circled by the president or that he would be reflecting on that.
sentences.chinese: 上面的第一条永远是,这一晚在伊拉克和阿富汗,士兵的伤亡报告，我来的时候会看到那条消息,被布什总统圈了出来,他看着报告会陷入沉思。

name: draft
trans: n. 汇票；草稿；选派；（尤指房间、烟囱、炉子等供暖系统中的）（小股）气流 vt. 起草；制定；征募 vi. 拟稿；绘样；作草图 adj. 初步画出或（写出）的；（设计、草图、提纲或版本）正在起草中的，草拟的；以草稿形式的；草图的

sentences.english: the rough draft of his new novel
sentences.chinese: 他的新小说的草稿

sentences.english: I read the first draft and thought it was very good.
sentences.chinese: 我读了第一稿，觉得非常好。

sentences.english: All parties eventually approved the final draft (= finished form ) of the peace treaty.
sentences.chinese: 各方最后都同意了和平条约的终稿。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of writing or a plan that is not yet in its finished form
to write a plan, letter, report etc that will need to be changed before it is in its finished form

name: paratrooper
trans: n. 伞兵

name: expedition
trans: n. 远征；探险队；迅速

sentences.english: an expedition to the North Pole
sentences.chinese: 北极探险

sentences.english: another Qomolangma expedition
sentences.chinese: 又一次珠穆朗玛峰探险

detailed_translations.english: a long and carefully organized journey, especially to a dangerous or unfamiliar place, or the people that make this journey

name: isolated
trans: adj. 偏远的；孤立的；孤独的；单独的； 绝缘的 v. 使……孤立；使……分离；将……剔出（isolate 的过去式和过去分词）

sentences.english: small isolated communities
sentences.chinese: 偏僻的小社区

sentences.english: Not many people visit this isolated spot.
sentences.chinese: 没有多少人到这个偏僻的地方来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 隔离的， 分离的； 与世隔绝的， 偏僻的； 孤立的， 孤独的； 个别的
detailed_translations.english: an isolated building, village etc is far away from any others

name: provisions
trans: n. 规定（provision的复数）；食品；预备 v. 供应补给品；供应粮食（provision的三单形式）

name: salvage

sentences.chinese: 他一听到在进行中的事，马上就给德国和意大利相应人员打电话抗议。

detailed_translations.english: Someone's or something's counterpart is another person or thing that has a similar function or position in a different place

name: drone

sentences.chinese: 而当你使用晶体管收音机时，你可以带着它到处走动，时至今日你可以把你收集的唱片装进口袋里。

sentences.chinese: 总统选择了忠诚的支持者到他的内阁服务。

name: conservation

sentences.chinese: 有灭绝危险的物种

sentences.chinese: 它们遭受猎杀，几近灭绝。

sentences.chinese: 村庄被毁，男人、女人和儿童惨遭杀戮。

sentences.english: Lack of chicken feed means that chicken farms are having to slaughter their stock.
sentences.chinese: 饲料不足意味着养鸡场将不得不宰杀鸡。

sentences.english: the slaughter of defenceless women and children
sentences.chinese: 对毫无自卫能力的妇孺的杀戮

sentences.english: the export of live animals for slaughter
sentences.chinese: 屠宰用活畜的出口

sentences.chinese: 死亡、离婚等的巨大痛苦

sentences.english: However, it is not only harmful to escape, but also beneficial for smoke to spread quickly to other floors if the smoke moves into the vertical escape evacuation routes while it is on fire.
sentences.chinese: 但是火灾发生后，作为人员逃生的竖向疏散通道如果遭受烟气侵害，不仅对人员的逃生不利，而且会加快烟气向其他楼层的蔓延。

sentences.english: In a fit of hysteria, Silvia blamed me for causing her father’s death.
sentences.chinese: 西尔维娅一阵歇斯底里，指责我害死了她父亲。

sentences.english: It takes a long time to overcome these kinds of prejudices.
sentences.chinese: 战胜这些偏见需要假以时日。

sentences.chinese: 有人担心媒体的报道会影响陪审团的公正性。

detailed_translations.english: an un-reasonable dislike and distrust of people who are different from you in some way, especially because of their race, sex, religion etc – used to show disapproval
to influence someone so that they have an unfair or unreasonable opinion about someone or something

name: epidemic
trans: adj. 流行的；传染性的 n. 传染病；流行病；风尚等的流行

sentences.english: Over 500 people died during last year’s flu epidemic.
sentences.chinese: 去年流感大暴发期间有五百多人死亡。

detailed_translations.english: a large number of cases of a disease that happen at the same time

name: immunity
trans: n. 免疫力；豁免权；免除

sentences.english: To protect you against small pox or diphtheria, you are vaccinated with a small amount of the toxin, and then your body develops immunity against that toxin.
sentences.chinese: 为了避免你长小脓包或得白喉病，所以会给你的身体接种小量毒素，然后你的身体会针对这些毒素产生免疫力。

sentences.english: Very few people will have any immunity to this particular combination, which is what gives the concern that this will be a pandemic rather than just a normal seasonal flu outbreak.
sentences.chinese: 因为很少有人具备对这种特别的混合病毒的免疫力。 人们因此担心，这将不仅仅是正常的季节性流感疫情，而是一次传染病的大流行。

sentences.english: But a new study shows that people with true expertise in a subject have some immunity to the siren song of corporate sponsorship.
sentences.chinese: 一项新的研究发现，在某一方面有真才实学的人们对广告赞助商的“糖衣炮弹”有一定的免疫力。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being immune to a disease

name: paralyze
trans: vt. 使麻痹；使瘫痪

sentences.english: You can bet that would truly paralyze the flow of credit: Does anyone believe Washington can manage banks?
sentences.chinese: 你可以打赌，这会使流动的信贷真正限于瘫痪：真有人相信华盛顿可以经营银行吗？

sentences.english: I think we would all agree that it is well worth it, yet many of us still choose to let this innate fear paralyze us and settle into comfortable, secure positions despite being unhappy in them.
sentences.chinese: 我想每个人都认同这些东西是值得的，但是我们中许多人尽管对目前处境不甚满意，仍然选择麻痹于内在的恐惧，停滞于安逸，保险的职位。

name: polio
trans: n. 小儿麻痹症（等于poliomyelitis）；脊髓灰质炎

sentences.english: Gladys was crippled by polio at the age of 3.
sentences.chinese: 格拉迪丝3岁时因小儿麻痹症而瘸了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 小儿麻痹症（等于poliomyelitis）；脊髓灰质炎
detailed_translations.english: a serious infectious disease of the nerves in the  spine  , that often results in someone being permanently unable to move particular muscles

name: vaccine
trans: n. 疫苗；牛痘苗 adj. 疫苗的；牛痘的

sentences.english: a polio vaccine
sentences.chinese: 小儿麻痹症疫苗

sentences.english: Doctors worried that there would not be enough vaccine for everyone who needed it.
sentences.chinese: 医生担心没有足够的疫苗给每个需要的人。

detailed_translations.english: a substance which contains a weak form of the bacteria or virus that causes a disease and is used to protect people from that disease

name: judicious
trans: adj. 明智的；头脑精明的；判断正确的

sentences.english: a judicious choice
sentences.chinese: 审慎而明智的选择

detailed_translations.chinese: 明智的；头脑精明的；判断正确的
detailed_translations.english: done in a sensible and careful way

name: lenient
trans: adj. 宽大的；仁慈的 n. (Lenient)人名；(法)勒尼安

sentences.english: the lenient sentences handed down by some judges
sentences.chinese: 一些法官作出的宽大判决

sentences.english: School examiners say that marking has become more lenient in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 学校的阅卷人称近年来评分标准放宽了。

detailed_translations.english: not strict in the way you punish someone or in the standard you expect

name: martyr
trans: n. 烈士，殉道者；乞怜者；因疾病或困难长期受折磨者；假圣人 v. 殉难；折磨；杀害 n. (Martyr) 马特（人名）

sentences.english: St. Stephen, the first Christian martyr
sentences.chinese: 圣司提反，第一个基督教殉道者

sentences.english: The army has been held back because the government is reluctant to make martyrs of the protesters.
sentences.chinese: 军队后撤了，因为政府不愿意造成抗议者牺牲。

sentences.english: St. Pancras was martyred in 304 A.D.
sentences.chinese: 圣·潘克瑞斯在公元304年蒙难。

detailed_translations.english: someone who dies for their religious or political beliefs and is admired by people for this
If someone is martyred, they are killed or made to suffer greatly because of their religious or political beliefs

name: ruthless
trans: adj. 无情的，残忍的

sentences.english: a ruthless dictator
sentences.chinese: 无情的独裁者

sentences.english: They have shown a ruthless disregard for basic human rights.
sentences.chinese: 他们冷酷地无视基本人权。

detailed_translations.english: so determined to get what you want that you do not care if you have to hurt other people in order to do it

name: tactician
trans: n. 战术家；谋士

sentences.english: He is an extremely astute political tactician.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个极精明的政治谋略家。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is very good at  tactics

name: boycott
trans: v. 联合抵制；拒绝购买；拒绝参加 n. 联合抵制 n. (Boycott) 博伊科特（人名）

sentences.english: We boycott all products tested on animals.
sentences.chinese: 我们抵制所有拿动物做试验的产品。

sentences.english: They are now trying to organize a boycott.
sentences.chinese: 他们正试图组织一场抵制行动。

detailed_translations.english: to refuse to buy something, use something, or take part in something as a way of protesting
an act of boycotting something, or the period of time when it is boycotted

name: ethic
trans: n. 伦理；道德规范 adj. 伦理的；道德的（等于ethical）

sentences.english: The old ethic of hard work has given way to a new ethic of instant gratification.
sentences.chinese: 旧有的崇尚勤勉的道德观已被及时行乐的新观念所取代。

detailed_translations.english: a general idea or belief that influences people’s behaviour and attitudes

name: expansion
trans: n. 膨胀；阐述；扩张物

sentences.english: The industry underwent a period of rapid expansion.
sentences.chinese: 该产业经历了一轮快速扩张。

detailed_translations.english: when something increases in size, range, amount etc

name: ministry
trans: n. （政府的）部门

sentences.english: the Ministry of Agriculture
sentences.chinese: 农业部

sentences.english: Converted in his early teens, he entered the ministry (= started working as a church leader ) in 1855.
sentences.chinese: 他十三四岁皈依基督教，1855年当上牧师。

sentences.english: the ministry of Jesus
sentences.chinese: 耶稣的传道工作

detailed_translations.chinese: （政府的）部；；（全体）牧师；牧师的职责
detailed_translations.english: a government department that is responsible for one of the areas of government work, such as education or health

name: Parliament
trans: n. 议会，国会

name: tenacious
trans: adj. 顽强的；坚韧的；固执的；紧握的；黏着力强的

sentences.english: a tenacious negotiator
sentences.chinese: 锲而不舍的谈判者

detailed_translations.chinese: 顽强的；坚韧的；固执的；紧握的；黏着力强的
detailed_translations.english: determined to do something and unwilling to stop trying even when the situation becomes difficult

name: absolution
trans: n. 赦免；免罪

sentences.english: Pope Leo gave him absolution.
sentences.chinese: 教皇列奥赦免了他的罪孽。

detailed_translations.english: when someone is formally forgiven by the Christian Church or a priest for the things they have done wrong

name: demigod
trans: n. 受崇拜的人，英雄人物；半神半人；小神

name: feat
trans: n. 功绩，壮举；技艺表演 adj. 合适的；灵巧的

sentences.english: A racing car is an extraordinary feat of engineering.
sentences.chinese: 赛车是工程学的一项非凡业绩。

detailed_translations.english: something that is an impressive achievement, because it needs a lot of skill, strength etc to do

name: immortalize
trans: vt. 使不灭；使名垂千古，使不朽

name: ingenuity
trans: n. 心灵手巧，独创性，足智多谋；精巧的装置

sentences.english: It’s limited only by your ingenuity!
sentences.chinese: 被束缚的仅仅是你的独创性！

sentences.english: Sitting with my IV drip, I like to think about all the human labour and ingenuity that come together in this medical moment.
sentences.chinese: 坐在那里进行着静脉点滴，我想到了所有的人类劳动和独创性在这一时刻汇聚到了一起。

sentences.english: And as the president said last week, no one should bet against the American worker, American business and American ingenuity.
sentences.chinese: 此外，正如总统上周所言，任何人都不应该小看美国的工人、美国的企业和美国的独创性。

name: artifact
trans: n. 人工制品，手工艺品；非自然存在物体（artefact 的另一种拼法）

sentences.english: In the wrong hands this powerful artifact has the ability to unravel the soul.
sentences.chinese: 在错误手这强有力的人工制品有能力解开灵魂。

name: docent
trans: n. 讲师；讲解员 n. (Docent)人名；(芬)多森特

name: gallery
trans: n. 画廊；走廊；旁听席；地道 vt. 在…修建走廊；在…挖地道 vi. 挖地道 n. (Gallery)人名；(英)加勒里

sentences.english: The bright modern painting stares out at you in the otherwise conservative gallery.
sentences.chinese: 有些古典派画廊也会陈列出明亮色彩的现代派绘画。

sentences.english: Statement and portrait together form a single image of a thinker. (See the interactive gallery, “Why Philosophy?
sentences.chinese: 陈述和肖像一起构成了一位思想家的独有影像。 （参见互动画廊，“何为哲学？”）

sentences.english: Whether you just want to browse our huge image gallery or want to share your personal photos with others, this is the site for you!
sentences.chinese: 无论你是想要浏览我们众多的画廊图片还是想要和其他人分享你的个人照片,这个网站绝对对你的味口。

detailed_translations.english: a small privately owned shop or studio where you can see and buy pieces of art

name: highlight
trans: v. 突出；强调；使显著；加亮；着亮彩于（头发） n. 最精彩的部分；最重要的事情；强光部分

sentences.english: Your résumé should highlight your skills and achievements.
sentences.chinese: 你的简历应该突出自己的技能和成绩。

sentences.english: That weekend in Venice was definitely the highlight of our trip.
sentences.chinese: 在威尼斯度过的那个周末无疑是我们这次旅行最精彩的部分。

detailed_translations.english: to make a problem or subject easy to notice so that people pay attention to it
the most important, interesting, or enjoyable part of something such as a holiday, performance, or sports competition

name: replicate
trans: vt. 复制；折叠 vi. 重复；折转 adj. 复制的；折叠的 n. 复制品；八音阶间隔的反覆音

sentences.english: There is a need for further research to replicate these findings.
sentences.chinese: 需要进一步的研究来验证这些结果。

detailed_translations.english: if you replicate someone’s work, a scientific study etc, you do it again, or try to get the same result again

detailed_translations.chinese: 复制品；八音阶间隔的反覆音

name: tapestry
trans: n. 织锦；挂毯；绣帷 vt. 用挂毯装饰

sentences.english: a colourful tapestry depicting a hunting scene
sentences.chinese: 描绘狩猎场面的彩色壁毯

detailed_translations.english: a large piece of heavy cloth on which coloured threads are woven to produce a picture, pattern etc

name: barter
trans: vi. 进行易货贸易；[贸易] 作物物交换；讨价还价 vt. 以…作为交换；拿…进行易货贸易 n. 易货贸易；物物交换；实物交易 n. (Barter)人名；(英)巴特

sentences.english: They have been bartering wheat for cotton and timber.
sentences.chinese: 他们一直在用小麦交换棉花和木材。

detailed_translations.chinese: 进行易货贸易；[贸易] 作物物交换；讨价还价
detailed_translations.english: to exchange goods, work, or services for other goods or services rather than for money

detailed_translations.chinese: 易货贸易；物物交换；实物交易
detailed_translations.english: a system of exchanging goods and services for other goods and services rather than using money

name: circulation
trans: n. 流通，传播；循环；发行量；（图书的）借出

sentences.english: Exercise improves the circulation.
sentences.chinese: 运动能促进血液循环。

sentences.english: The Treasury Department plans to remove older coins from circulation and replace them with new ones.
sentences.chinese: 财政部打算收回市面上流通的旧版硬币，以新版取代。

detailed_translations.chinese: 血液循环；（资料、货币等）流通
detailed_translations.english: the movement of blood around your body

name: counterfeit
trans: adj. （钱币或商品）伪造的，假冒的；（古旧用法）假装的，虚假的 v. 伪造，仿造，造假；假装；（文）酷似 n. 仿冒品，伪造物，赝品

sentences.english: They admitted counterfeiting documents.
sentences.chinese: 他们承认伪造了文件。

sentences.english: Levi Strauss says counterfeits of the company's jeans are flooding Europe.
sentences.chinese: 利瓦伊·斯特劳斯说该公司牛仔裤的仿冒品充斥着欧洲市场。

detailed_translations.english: to copy something exactly in order to deceive people
Counterfeit is also a noun
made to look exactly like something else, in order to deceive people

name: currency
trans: n. 货币；通货

sentences.english: The bank can supply you with foreign currency .
sentences.chinese: 这家银行能为你提供外币。

sentences.english: There are moves towards a single currency in Europe.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲有向单一货币发展的趋势。

sentences.english: The local currency is the Swiss franc.
sentences.chinese: 当地的货币是瑞士法郎。

detailed_translations.english: the system or type of money that a country uses

name: denomination
trans: n. 面额；名称；教派

sentences.english: Christians of all denominations
sentences.chinese: 各教派的基督徒

detailed_translations.english: a religious group that has different beliefs from other groups within the same religion

name: mint
trans: n. 薄荷；[金融] 造币厂，巨款 vt. 铸造，铸币 adj. 完美的 n. (Mint)人名；(毛里塔)明特

sentences.english: new potatoes sprinkled with chopped mint
sentences.chinese: 撒上薄荷屑的嫩马铃薯

sentences.english: roast lamb with mint sauce
sentences.chinese: 配薄荷调味汁的烤羔羊肉

sentences.english: Decorate with a sprig of mint .
sentences.chinese: 用小薄荷枝装饰。

detailed_translations.chinese: 薄荷；[金融] 造币厂，巨款
detailed_translations.english: a small plant with green leaves that have a fresh smell and taste and are used in cooking
to make a coin
looking new and in perfect condition

name: archaeologist
trans: n. 考古学家

sentences.english: In fact, she was an archaeologist.
sentences.chinese: 其实她是一个考古学家。

sentences.english: But I do not believe, as a field archaeologist, that we can use the scientific method to prove or disprove [them].
sentences.chinese: 但作为一个在现场工作的考古学家，我不相信我们能用科学手段对它们进行证实或证伪”。

name: deity
trans: n. 神；神性

sentences.english: the deities of ancient Greece
sentences.chinese: 古希腊诸神

detailed_translations.english: a god or  goddess

name: embalm
trans: vt. 铭记于心；使不朽；防腐；使充满香气

sentences.english: His body was embalmed.
sentences.chinese: 他的尸体进行了防腐处理。

detailed_translations.chinese: 铭记于心；使不朽；防腐；使充满香气
detailed_translations.english: to treat a dead body with chemicals, oils etc to prevent it from decaying

name: monotheist
trans: n. 一神论者

name: sarcophagus
trans: n. （雕刻精美的）石棺；（古希腊人用来制石棺的）大理石

name: ambition
trans: n. 野心，雄心；抱负，志向 vt. 追求；有…野心

sentences.english: He was young and full of ambition.
sentences.chinese: 他年轻，而且雄心勃勃。

detailed_translations.english: determination to be successful, rich, powerful etc

name: blockade
trans: n. 包围，封锁；障碍物；阻滞，阻塞 v. 封锁

sentences.english: The ships blockaded the port.
sentences.chinese: 船只封锁了港口。

detailed_translations.english: to put a place under a blockade
something that is used to stop vehicles or people entering or leaving a place

name: empire
trans: n. 帝国；帝王统治，君权 n. (Empire)人名；(法)昂皮尔

sentences.english: the Roman empire
sentences.chinese: 罗马帝国

detailed_translations.english: a group of countries that are all controlled by one ruler or government

name: Enlightenment
trans: n. 启迪；启蒙运动；教化

name: exile
trans: n. 流放，充军；放逐，被放逐者；流犯 vt. 放逐，流放；使背井离乡

sentences.english: the exiled former president
sentences.chinese: 流亡国外的前总统

sentences.english: political exiles
sentences.chinese: 政治流亡者

detailed_translations.english: to force someone to leave their country, especially for political reasons
a person who is forced to live away from his or her own country

name: reform
trans: v. 改革，革新；重组；（使）改过自新；（石油炼制）重整 n. 改革，改良；改正 adj. 改革的；改革教会的

sentences.english: plans to radically reform the tax system
sentences.chinese: 彻底改革税收制度的计划

detailed_translations.chinese: 改革， 改良， 改造； 改正， 改过自新
detailed_translations.english: to improve a system, law, organization etc by making a lot of changes to it, so that it operates in a fairer or more effective way

name: circumnavigate
trans: vt. 环航

sentences.english: For this year at least, our race to circumnavigate the globe in less than 80 days is over.
sentences.chinese: 至少在今年，我们在八十天内完成环球航行结束了。

detailed_translations.english: to sail, fly, or travel completely around the Earth, an island etc

name: corruption
trans: n. 贪污，腐败；堕落

sentences.english: officials charged with bribery and corruption
sentences.chinese: 被指控受贿和贪污的官员

sentences.english: The investigation uncovered widespread corruption within the police force.
sentences.chinese: 这项调查揭发出了警察机关内部普遍的腐败。

detailed_translations.english: dishonest, illegal, or immoral behaviour, especially from someone with power

name: dismissive
trans: adj. 轻蔑的，鄙视的，不加考虑的，不屑一顾的

name: journalist
trans: n. 新闻工作者；报人；记日志者

sentences.english: a well-known journalist and broadcaster
sentences.chinese: 一位著名的新闻记者兼播音员

detailed_translations.english: someone who writes news reports for newspapers, magazines, television, or radio

name: condemned
trans: adj. 已被定罪的，被判死刑的；危险的；被责难的

name: delirium
trans: n. 精神错乱；发狂，狂热；说谵语状态

sentences.english: Before she died she had fits of delirium.
sentences.chinese: 去世前她一阵阵地胡言乱语。

detailed_translations.chinese: 神智昏迷，说胡话；极度兴奋
detailed_translations.english: extreme excitement

name: intolerable
trans: adj. 无法忍受的；难耐的

sentences.english: ‘This is intolerable!’ exclaimed Sir Rufus.
sentences.chinese: “这真令人难以忍受！”鲁弗斯爵士喊道。

sentences.english: The pain had become intolerable.
sentences.chinese: 痛得不能忍受。

detailed_translations.english: too difficult, bad, annoying etc for you to accept or deal with

name: suffocation
trans: n. 窒息；闷死

name: canal
trans: n. 运河；[地理] 水道；[建] 管道；灌溉水渠 vt. 在…开凿运河 n. (Canal)人名；(英、法、西、意、葡)卡纳尔；(土)贾纳尔

sentences.english: We walked along by the side of the canal.
sentences.chinese: 我们沿着运河边往前走。

sentences.english: the Panama Canal
sentences.chinese: 巴拿马运河

detailed_translations.chinese: 运河；[地理] 水道；[建] 管道；灌溉水渠
detailed_translations.english: a long passage dug into the ground and filled with water, either for boats to travel along, or to take water to a place

name: commerce
trans: n. 贸易；商业；商务

sentences.english: measures promoting local commerce and industry
sentences.chinese: 促进地方工商业发展的措施

detailed_translations.english: the buying and selling of goods and services

name: engineering
trans: n. 工程，工程学 v. 设计；管理（engineer的ing形式）；建造

sentences.english: The bridge is a triumph of modern engineering.
sentences.chinese: 这座桥是现代工程的一大成就。

sentences.english: a degree in engineering
sentences.chinese: 工程学学位

detailed_translations.english: the activity of applying scientific knowledge to the design, building and control of machines, roads, bridges, electrical equipment, etc.

name: isthmus
trans: n. 地峡；管峡

name: lock
trans: v. （用锁）锁上；被锁住；把……锁起来；（使）固定；陷入；被紧紧抓住（或抱住）；加锁；过船闸 n. 锁；车锁；（机器部件等的）锁定；前轮转向角度；船闸；一缕头发；（并列争球的）第二排前锋；（对某物的）完全控制；（摔跤及武术用语）抱，夹；（交通） 堵塞；完全转向；枪栓；毛撮 n. (Lock) （美）洛克（人名）

sentences.english: I’m sorry, there isn’t a lock on the bathroom door.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，浴室门上没有锁。

sentences.english: The key turned stiffly in the lock.
sentences.chinese: 这把钥匙开锁不灵活。

sentences.english: a bike lock
sentences.chinese: 自行车锁

sentences.english: Did you lock the car?
sentences.chinese: 你把汽车锁好了吗？

detailed_translations.english: a thing that keeps a door, drawer etc fastened and is usually opened with a key or by moving a small metal bar
to fasten something, usually with a key, so that other people cannot open it, or to be fastened like this

name: oligarchy
trans: n. 寡头政治

name: repercussion
trans: n. 反响；弹回；反射；浮动诊胎法；令人不满意的后果

sentences.english: It was an effort which was to have painful repercussions.
sentences.chinese: 那是一个将产生沉痛后果的尝试。

detailed_translations.chinese: 反响；弹回；反射；浮动诊胎法；令人不满意的后果
detailed_translations.english: the effects of an action or event, especially bad effects that continue for some time

name: sanction
trans: n. 制裁，处罚；认可；支持 vt. 制裁，处罚；批准；鼓励

sentences.english: a resolution to impose sanctions (= start using sanctions ) on DPRK
sentences.chinese: 对朝鲜实施制裁的决议

sentences.english: the threat of trade sanctions
sentences.chinese: 贸易制裁的威胁

sentences.english: The UN security council may impose economic sanctions .
sentences.chinese: 联合国安理会可能会实施经济制裁。

sentences.english: Any talk about lifting sanctions (= ending them ) is premature.
sentences.chinese: 现时就谈取消制裁为时过早。

detailed_translations.english: official orders or laws stopping trade, communication etc with another country, as a way of forcing its leaders to make political changes
to officially accept or allow something

name: era
trans: n. 时代；年代；纪元 n. (Era)人名；(意、芬、印)埃拉

sentences.english: His death marked the end of an era.
sentences.chinese: 他的去世标志着一个时代的终结。

sentences.english: the Victorian era
sentences.chinese: 维多利亚时代

detailed_translations.english: a period of time in history that is known for a particular event, or for particular qualities

name: invertebrate
trans: adj. 无脊椎的；无骨气的 n. 无脊椎动物；无骨气的人

sentences.english: Concept artist Terryl Whitlatch wanted the colo claw fish to have an invertebrate look, so her early designs were based on an earwig.
sentences.chinese: 概念画家特丽尔·惠特拉奇希望科洛爪鱼拥有无脊椎动物的外表，所以她的早期设计是以蠼螋为基础的。

sentences.english: There was a hierarchical system in neurobiology, and working in invertebrate animals was not looked upon favorably, except in a very special case: the squid giant axon.
sentences.chinese: 神经生物学中有一个等级系统，无脊椎动物的研究不被看好，除了非常特殊的例子：枪乌贼巨大的轴突。

sentences.english: Smithers, don't you think it's ironic that your irregular night-time activities are in inverse proportion to your reputation as an expert in the area of invertebrate research?
sentences.chinese: 斯密德斯，难道你不认为自己无规律的夜生活与你作为无脊椎动物研究领域的专家的声望成反比是具有讽刺意味的吗？

detailed_translations.english: a living creature that does not have a  backbone

name: paleontologist
trans: n. 古生物学者

sentences.english: As a result, the research has the potential to change the way a paleontologist views a fossil.
sentences.chinese: 现在，研究者们已经拥有了改变一个古生物学家观察化石方式的潜力。

sentences.english: Even the tracks alone say a lot about the feeding behavior of the ancient birds, commented paleontologist Martin Lockley of the University of Colorado in Denver.
sentences.chinese: 丹佛科罗拉多大学的古生物学家马丁•劳克雷评论说，即使只有这些足迹也很能说明这些古代鸟类的进食行为。

sentences.english: This study "provides conclusive genetic evidence for the simultaneous burial of a small nuclear family, " said Louise Humphrey, a paleontologist with the Natural History Museum in London.
sentences.chinese: 这一研究“用基因证明了这是个同期的小核心家庭，”路易斯·汉弗莱说到，他是伦敦自然历史博物馆的一名古生物学家。

name: period
trans: n. 周期，期间；时期；一段时间；经期；课时；句点，句号 adj. 某一时代的

sentences.english: Tomorrow’s weather will be dry with sunny periods.
sentences.chinese: 明天天气干燥，间或晴朗。

sentences.english: a double period of Science
sentences.chinese: 一连两节的自然科学课

sentences.english: Pay attention to punctuation, especially to the correct use of commas and periods.
sentences.chinese: 注意标点，特别是逗号和句号的正确使用方法。

detailed_translations.english: a particular length of time with a beginning and an end

trans: adj. 史前的；陈旧的

sentences.english: prehistoric burial grounds
sentences.chinese: 史前墓地

sentences.english: prehistoric animals
sentences.chinese: 史前动物

detailed_translations.english: relating to the time in history before anything was written down

name: capsule
trans: n. 胶囊；蒴果；太空舱；小容器 adj. 压缩的；概要的 vt. 压缩；简述

sentences.english: a space capsule orbiting the Earth
sentences.chinese: 沿地球轨道飞行的太空舱

detailed_translations.chinese: 胶囊； 航天舱， 密封舱
detailed_translations.english: a plastic container shaped like a very small tube with medicine inside that you swallow whole

name: commercial
trans: adj. 商业的；营利的；靠广告收入的 n. 商业广告

sentences.english: Our top priorities must be profit and commercial growth.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须把利润和贸易增长作为我们的第一要务。

detailed_translations.chinese: 商业的， 商务的； 商品化的， 商业性的
detailed_translations.english: related to business and the buying and selling of goods and services

name: entrepreneur
trans: n. 企业家；承包人；主办者

sentences.english: “You have to be an optimist to be an inventor or entrepreneur, ” he concludes.
sentences.chinese: 要成为一位发明家或企业家，你必须得是个乐天派。

sentences.english: If any of you end up being entrepreneur, which I hope you will be, what do you have in store for yourself, and what does that journey look like?
sentences.chinese: 如果你们当中任何一个人成了企业家，这也是我希望你们做到的，你自己会有什么样的储备，那样的一段旅程又将是什么样的？

sentences.english: How would you define personal growth as an entrepreneur?
sentences.chinese: 你会如何定义,一个企业家的个人成长？

detailed_translations.english: someone who starts a new business or arranges business deals in order to make money, often in a way that involves financial risks

name: orbit
trans: n. 轨道；眼眶；势力范围；生活常规 vi. 盘旋；绕轨道运行 vt. 绕…轨道而行

sentences.english: Mars and Earth have orbits which change with time.
sentences.chinese: 火星和地球的轨道随着时间而发生改变。

detailed_translations.english: the curved path travelled by an object which is moving around another much larger object such as the Earth, the Sun etc
to travel in a curved path around a much larger object such as the Earth, the Sun etc

name: spacecraft
trans: n. [航] 宇宙飞船，航天器

sentences.english: the world's largest and most expensive unmanned spacecraft
sentences.chinese: 世界上最大、最贵的无人航天器

detailed_translations.english: a vehicle that is able to travel in space

name: armada
trans: n. （西班牙的）无敌舰队

sentences.english: This armada of robots will be our eyes, ears, arms and legs in space, in the air, and on the ground, capable of responding to their environment without us, to explore and embrace the unknown.
sentences.chinese: 这个机器人舰队将是我们的眼睛、耳朵、手臂和腿，它们分布在太空中、大气层内，以及地面上，在没有我们的情况下也可以对自身所处的环境做出反应，接近并探测未知世界。

detailed_translations.english: An armada is a large group of warships

name: conspire
trans: vi. 共谋；协力 vt. [法] 密谋策划

sentences.english: They'd conspired to overthrow the government.
sentences.chinese: 他们曾合谋推翻政府。

sentences.chinese: 本·贝拉先生在1965年的一次政变中被罢免了。

detailed_translations.english: to remove a leader or ruler from a position of power

trans: adj. 私生的；非法的；不合理的 vt. 认做私生子；认为违法 n. 非嫡出子；庶子

sentences.english: his illegitimate son
sentences.chinese: 他的私生子

detailed_translations.chinese: 私生的；非法的；不合理的

sentences.chinese: 王子如果去世，就由他的儿子继承。

sentences.chinese: 国际外交

detailed_translations.chinese: 外交；外交手腕；交际手段
detailed_translations.english: the job or activity of managing the relationships between countries

sentences.chinese: 哈布斯堡王朝在1278至1918年间统治奥地利。

sentences.chinese: 我所采用的图案是类似符号的象形文字。

sentences.english: In the Late Period, the hieroglyph of the bird was used to represent this deity directly.
sentences.chinese: 在后来的时期内，鸟的象形文字直接用来表现神。

sentences.english: Initially the patterns I used were hieroglyph like symbols. After a holiday in the Maldives the "face" patterns developed. The local fishes gave me endless inspiration.
sentences.chinese: 我所采用的图案是类似符号的象形文字。在马尔代夫度假后，这些“脸”的图形开始发展。那里的鱼类给了我无穷无尽的灵感。

detailed_translations.chinese: 象形文字, 图画文字

trans: n. 继承者；后续的事物

sentences.chinese: 他制定出了几条原则,希望能指导其继任者。

trans: vt. 恳求；请求 vi. 恳求；乞求

sentences.english: His friends entreated him not to go.
sentences.chinese: 他的朋友们恳求他不要去。

sentences.english: He entreated them to delay their departure.
sentences.chinese: 他恳求他们晚些再走。

detailed_translations.english: to ask someone, in a very emotional way, to do something for you

trans: vt. 恳求或乞求 vi. 恳求或乞求

sentences.english: ‘Don’t go,’ I implored her.
sentences.chinese: “不要走。”我哀求她。

detailed_translations.english: to ask for something in an emotional way

trans: n. （据传说古希腊人用的）忘忧药（形容词nepenthean）；解忧烦之物

name: prophet

sentences.english: the prophet Elijah
sentences.chinese: 先知以利亚

detailed_translations.english: a man who people in the Christian, Jewish, or Muslim religion believe has been sent by God to lead them and teach them their religion

name: encroaching
trans: adj. 渐渐渗入的

trans: n. 冰河，冰川

sentences.english: The glacier calved a large iceberg.
sentences.chinese: 冰川崩解而产生一个大冰山。

sentences.english: The glacier dislocated great stones.
sentences.chinese: 冰川使许多大石块移位了。

sentences.english: A river or glacier debouches on the plains.
sentences.chinese: 一条河流或冰川流向平原。

trans: [海洋] 海平面

sentences.chinese: 政府的长期经济策略

sentences.english: a company’s business strategy
sentences.chinese: 公司的经营策略

detailed_translations.english: a planned series of actions for achieving something

name: ambush
trans: n. 埋伏，伏击；伏兵 vt. 埋伏，伏击 vi. 埋伏

sentences.english: The soldiers were killed in an ambush.
sentences.chinese: 那些士兵遭伏击身亡。

sentences.english: In winter the danger of ambush is much reduced.
sentences.chinese: 冬天，遭伏击的危险大大减少。

sentences.english: The Guatemalan army says rebels ambushed and killed 10 patrolmen.
sentences.chinese: 危地马拉军方称叛军伏击并杀死了10名巡逻兵。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden attack on someone by people who have been hiding and waiting for them, or the place where this happens
If a group of people ambush their enemies, they attack them after hiding and waiting for them

name: glamorize

sentences.english: TV has been accused of glamorizing crime.
sentences.chinese: 有人指责电视美化犯罪。

detailed_translations.english: to make something seem more attractive than it really is

sentences.english: Gather the right crew: You’ll need the right partners in crime to pull the heist.
sentences.chinese: 召集合适的搭档： 你将需要一些合适的正在犯罪的搭档去抢劫。

sentences.english: It had not been much of a heist; he said his accomplice “got some change” but he got nothing.
sentences.chinese: 那都说不上是一次抢劫，他说他的同谋“搞了点零钱”而他一无所获。

sentences.english: Angelina plays Gloria, a young girl whose brother was killed in the heist-gone-wrong.
sentences.chinese: 安吉丽娜饰演格罗瑞亚，她的哥哥在那次抢劫中被误杀。

detailed_translations.english: A heist is a robbery, especially one in which money, jewellery, or art is stolen

name: notorious
trans: adj. 声名狼藉的，臭名昭著的

sentences.english: a notorious computer hacker
sentences.chinese: 声名狼藉的电脑黑客

sentences.english: notorious cases of human rights abuses
sentences.chinese: 臭名昭著的践踏人权案

detailed_translations.english: famous or well-known for something bad

name: posse
trans: n. 一队；民防团；地方武装团队 n. (Posse)人名；(法)波斯；(瑞典)波瑟；(西)波塞

sentences.english: ...a posse of reporters.
sentences.chinese: ...一群记者。

detailed_translations.chinese: 一队；民防团；地方武装团队
detailed_translations.english: a group of the same kind of people

name: campaign
trans: n. 运动；活动；战役，军事行动；竞选 v. 领导或参加运动；参加竞选

sentences.english: Jones ran a good campaign.
sentences.chinese: 琼斯的活动搞得很成功。

sentences.english: Police have launched a campaign to crack down on drug dealers.
sentences.chinese: 警方发起了一场严厉打击毒贩的运动。

detailed_translations.english: a series of actions intended to achieve a particular result relating to politics or business, or a social improvement

name: debate
trans: n. 辩论；（正式的）讨论 v. （尤指正式）讨论，辩论；仔细考虑

sentences.english: the gun-control debate in the US
sentences.chinese: 美国有关控制枪支的争论

sentences.english: The new drug has become the subject of heated debate within the medical profession.
sentences.chinese: 这种新药成了医学界激烈争论的话题。

sentences.english: There was much lively debate about whether women should spend more time in the home.
sentences.chinese: 就妇女是否应该花更多时间待在家里这个话题有许多热烈的争论。

sentences.english: A fierce debate raged over which artist’s work should be chosen for the prize.
sentences.chinese: 就哪位艺术家的作品应该得奖一事展开了激烈的争论。

sentences.english: The issue will be debated on Tuesday.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题将在星期二讨论。

detailed_translations.english: discussion of a particular subject that often continues for a long time and in which people express different opinions
to discuss a subject formally when you are trying to make a decision or find a solution

name: monotonous
trans: adj. 单调的，无抑扬顿挫的；无变化的

sentences.english: a monotonous diet
sentences.chinese: 单调的饮食

sentences.english: a little boy who wet his bed with monotonous regularity
sentences.chinese: 一个老是尿床的小男孩

detailed_translations.english: boring because of always being the same

name: regiment
trans: n. （军事单位）团；大量的人；统治，管辖 v. 对……严格管制；把（部队）编成团

sentences.english: the regimented routine of boarding school
sentences.chinese: 寄宿学校严格的生活规律

detailed_translations.english: to organize and control people firmly and usually too strictly
a large group of soldiers, usually consisting of several  battalion s

name: speculate
trans: vi. 推测；投机；思索 vt. 推断

sentences.english: She refused to speculate.
sentences.chinese: 她拒绝猜测。

detailed_translations.english: to guess about the possible causes or effects of something, without knowing all the facts or details

name: valor
trans: n. 英勇；勇猛（等于valour） n. (Valor)人名；(西)巴洛尔

sentences.english: The troops showed great valor .
sentences.chinese: 军队表现出极大的英勇。

sentences.english: Fortitude is distinct from valor .
sentences.chinese: 刚毅与勇猛不同。

sentences.english: They owed their lives to the valor of the firemen.
sentences.chinese: 他们将其生命归功于消防员的英勇。 英勇。

name: contemplate
trans: vt. 沉思；注视；思忖；预期 vi. 冥思苦想；深思熟虑

sentences.english: He had even contemplated suicide.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至想过自杀。

sentences.english: Jack went on vacation to contemplate his future.
sentences.chinese: 杰克去度假，仔细思考一下他的未来。

sentences.english: He contemplated her with a faint smile.
sentences.chinese: 他微微含笑注视着她。

detailed_translations.chinese: 考虑；深思；细想；注视，凝视
detailed_translations.english: to think about something that you might do in the future

name: fracas
trans: n. 吵闹；喧噪 n. (Fracas)人名；(意)弗拉卡斯

name: sullen
trans: adj. 愠怒的，不高兴的；（天气）阴沉的；沉闷的

sentences.english: Bill sat in sullen silence and refused to eat his lunch.
sentences.chinese: 比尔一声不响，闷闷不乐地坐着，不肯吃午饭。

sentences.english: a look of sullen resentment
sentences.chinese: 愤懑的眼神

detailed_translations.chinese: 愠怒的，不高兴的；（天气）阴沉的；沉闷的
detailed_translations.english: angry and silent, especially because you feel life has been unfair to you

name: bewildered

name: determination

sentences.english: his dogged determination (= very strong determination ) to succeed
sentences.chinese: 他想要成功的坚定决心

detailed_translations.english: the quality of trying to do something even when it is difficult

name: insignificant

sentences.chinese: 要知道，你的问题相对来说微不足道。

detailed_translations.english: too small or unimportant to consider or worry about

name: profound

sentences.english: a profound question
sentences.chinese: 深刻的问题

sentences.english: Jenner is a profound thinker.
sentences.chinese: 詹纳是个思想深刻的人。

sentences.english: A new tax was imposed on fuel.
sentences.chinese: 当局开始对燃油征收一项新税。

detailed_translations.english: If you impose your opinions or beliefs on other people, you try and make people accept them as a rule or as a model to copy

name: legislature
trans: n. 立法机关；立法机构

sentences.english: The proposals before the legislature include the creation of two special courts to deal exclusively with violent crimes.
sentences.chinese: 摆在议会面前的提案包括建立两个特殊法庭专门审理暴力犯罪案件。

detailed_translations.english: an institution that has the power to make or change laws

name: deliverance
trans: n. 释放，解救；救助；判决

sentences.english: The opening scene shows them celebrating their sudden deliverance from war.
sentences.chinese: 开始的场景展示他们正在庆祝从战争中突然获救。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being saved from harm or danger

name: desolate
trans: adj. 荒凉的；无人烟的 vt. 使荒凉；使孤寂

sentences.english: a desolate landscape
sentences.chinese: 荒凉的景色

detailed_translations.english: a place that is desolate is empty and looks sad because there are no people there
a place that is desolate is empty and looks sad because there are no people there
someone who is desolate feels very sad and lonely

name: diligence
trans: n. 勤奋，勤勉；注意的程度

sentences.english: Genius is nothing but labor and diligence.
sentences.chinese: 天才无非是工作和勤奋。

sentences.english: We should cultivate the good habits of diligence and frugality.
sentences.chinese: 我们要养成勤俭节约的好风气。

name: fortify
trans: vt. 加强；增强；（酒）的酒精含量；设防于 vi. 筑防御工事

sentences.english: Her position was fortified by election successes and economic recovery.
sentences.chinese: 她的地位因为选举获胜及经济复苏而得到巩固。

detailed_translations.english: to encourage an attitude or feeling and make it stronger
to build towers, walls etc around an area or city in order to defend it

name: prospect
trans: n. 前途；预期；景色 vi. 勘探，找矿 vt. 勘探，勘察

sentences.english: The prospect of marriage terrified Alice.
sentences.chinese: 想到要结婚，艾丽斯害怕极了。

sentences.english: I had no job, no education, and no prospects .
sentences.chinese: 我没有工作，没受过什么教育，前途渺茫。

detailed_translations.english: a particular event which will probably or definitely happen in the future – used especially when you want to talk about how you feel about it

name: controversial
trans: adj. 有争议的；有争论的

sentences.english: the controversial issue of welfare reform
sentences.chinese: 福利改革这一有争议的话题

sentences.english: a highly controversial (= very controversial ) plan to flood the valley in order to build a dam
sentences.chinese: 一个把山谷淹掉来建造水坝的极具争议的计划

sentences.english: He is a controversial figure (= person who does controversial things ) in the art world.
sentences.chinese: 他是艺术界极具争议的人物。

detailed_translations.english: causing a lot of disagreement, because many people have strong opinions about the subject being discussed

name: cosmology
trans: n. [天] 宇宙论，[天] 宇宙学

name: diagnosis
trans: n. 诊断

sentences.english: An exact diagnosis can only be made by obtaining a blood sample.
sentences.chinese: 只有抽取血样才能作出准确的诊断。

detailed_translations.english: the process of discovering exactly what is wrong with someone or something, by examining them closely

name: fellowship
trans: n. 团体；友谊；奖学金；研究员职位

sentences.english: Regular outings contribute to a sense of fellowship among co-workers.
sentences.chinese: 经常外出游玩可以增进同事之间的友谊。

sentences.english: ...the National Schizophrenia Fellowship.
sentences.chinese: …全国精神分裂协会。

detailed_translations.chinese: 伙伴关系,友情,友谊；团体
detailed_translations.english: a feeling of friendship resulting from shared interests or experiences

name: inquiry
trans: n. 探究；调查；质询

sentences.english: I don’t know who sent the gift, but I’ll make some inquiries.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道礼物是谁送的，但我会打听一下。

sentences.english: The police have launched a murder inquiry.
sentences.chinese: 警方已开始对谋杀案展开调查

detailed_translations.english: a question you ask in order to get information

name: interdependent
trans: adj. 相互依赖的；互助的

sentences.english: countries with interdependent economies
sentences.chinese: 经济上相互依赖的国家

detailed_translations.english: depending on or necessary to each other

name: parasite
trans: n. 寄生虫；食客

sentences.english: Kangaroos harbour a vast range of parasites.
sentences.chinese: 袋鼠身上有各种各样的寄生虫。

detailed_translations.english: a plant or animal that lives on or in another plant or animal and gets food from it

name: propagate
trans: vt. 传播；传送；繁殖；宣传 vi. 繁殖；增殖

sentences.english: The group launched a website to propagate its ideas.
sentences.chinese: 这个团体建了一个网站来宣扬他们的主张。

sentences.english: The plant can be propagated from seed.
sentences.chinese: 这种植物可由种子繁殖。

detailed_translations.english: to spread an idea, belief etc to many people

name: refuge
trans: n. 避难；避难所；庇护 vt. 给予…庇护；接纳…避难 vi. 避难；逃避

sentences.english: a wildlife refuge
sentences.chinese: 野生动物保护区

detailed_translations.english: shelter or protection from someone or something

name: symbiotic
trans: adj. [生态] 共生的；共栖的

sentences.english: ...fungi that have a symbiotic relationship with the trees of these northwestern forests.
sentences.chinese: ...与这些位于西北部的森林里的树木存在共生关系的真菌。

detailed_translations.english: a symbiotic relationship is one in which the people, organizations, or living things involved depend on each other

name: discrimination
trans: n. 歧视；区别，辨别；识别力

sentences.english: laws to prevent discrimination
sentences.chinese: 防止歧视的法律

sentences.english: shape discrimination
sentences.chinese: 形状识别力

detailed_translations.english: the practice of treating one person or group differently from another in an unfair way

name: engineer
trans: n. 工程师；工兵；火车司机 vt. 设计；策划；精明地处理 vi. 设计；建造

sentences.english: He trained as a civil engineer (= one who designs and builds roads, bridges etc ).
sentences.chinese: 他接受过土木工程师培训。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to design or build roads, bridges, machines etc

name: immigrant
trans: adj. 移民的；迁入的 n. 移民，侨民

sentences.english: an illegal immigrant
sentences.chinese: 非法移民

sentences.english: a new wave of immigrants from the Middle East
sentences.chinese: 来自中东的一股新兴的移民浪潮

detailed_translations.english: someone who enters another country to live there permanently

name: laborer
trans: n. 劳动者；工人

sentences.english: Traditionally cut blue jeans carry a whiff of the laborer about them, so denim on a leader suggests a willingness to roll up the sleeves and dig in.
sentences.chinese: 传统剪裁的蓝色牛仔裤带有一种劳动者的气息，因此领导者穿着仔裤可以表达一种愿意卷起袖子大干一场的意思。

sentences.english: It is no use offering the manual laborer, tired out with a hard week’s sweat and effort, the chance of playing a game of football or baseball on Saturday afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 对于那些体力劳动者来说，一周辛苦的工作使他们精疾力竭，因此在周六下午给他们提供踢足球或者打棒球的机会是没有意义的。

sentences.english: Basically, in 2009, the life of a wage laborer has the same essential features in every corner of the globe.
sentences.chinese: 在2009年，工资劳动者的生活，其基本特征在全球的各个角落都是大致相同的。

name: pursuit
trans: n. 追赶，追求；职业，工作

sentences.english: The quarterback sprinted toward the end zone with Jansen in hot pursuit (= following closely behind ) .
sentences.chinese: 那名四分卫快速冲向底线区，詹森穷追不舍。

detailed_translations.english: when someone tries to get, achieve, or find something in a determined way

name: veteran
trans: n. 老兵；老手；富有经验的人；老运动员 adj. 经验丰富的；老兵的

sentences.english: He is a veteran of the last revolution in medical technology, gene therapy, which, after some hyped expectations in the 1990s, fell into disfavor after some unsuccessful trials.
sentences.chinese: 他是基因治疗这项最新医学技术的老手，经过了1990年代的兴奋期和之后几次失败的实验后，基因治疗技术已经失宠了。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has been a soldier, sailor etc in a war

name: committee
trans: n. 委员会

sentences.english: a committee meeting
sentences.chinese: 委员会会议

detailed_translations.english: a group of people chosen to do a particular job, make decisions etc

name: diplomat
trans: n. 外交家，外交官；有外交手腕的人；处事圆滑机敏的人

sentences.english: French diplomats
sentences.chinese: 法国外交官

detailed_translations.english: someone who officially represents their government in a foreign country

name: humanitarian
trans: adj. 人道主义的；博爱的；基督凡人论的 n. 人道主义者；慈善家；博爱主义者；基督凡人论者

sentences.english: And on each of those issues we have said that we would consider that and, in fact, have provided some humanitarian support.
sentences.chinese: 对于每一件这样的事情，我们都说过，我们将会对此进行考虑，事实上，我们向他们提供了人道主义援助。

sentences.english: But part of trying to do what is right for the Burmese people is to provide humanitarian assistance in this time of extreme need.
sentences.chinese: 但是，对缅甸人民来说，正确的行动部分是为他们提供人道主义援助，而在目前这个时刻更是极端的需要”。

sentences.english: But otherwise, it is best left to the humanitarian experts, who will be there after you are gone and therefore need to preserve their independence and their impartiality.
sentences.chinese: 但是，如果不能，最好将这些任务留给人道主义专家，这些专家在部队撤退之后仍将留在那，因此需要保持他们的独立和公正。

name: international
trans: adj. 国际的；国际通用的 n. 国际体育比赛（选手）；外国人 n. (International) 共产国际（组织）

sentences.english: the response of the international community
sentences.chinese: 国际社会的反响

sentences.english: the UN and other international organizations
sentences.chinese: 联合国和其他国际组织

detailed_translations.english: relating to or involving more than one nation

name: organization
trans: n. 组织；机构；体制；团体

sentences.english: The public expect high standards from any large organization.
sentences.chinese: 公众对任何大型机构都期望很高。

sentences.english: the World Trade Organization
sentences.chinese: 世界贸易组织

sentences.english: a voluntary organization which helps disabled people with their transport needs
sentences.chinese: 帮助残疾人士满足其交通需求的一个志愿组织

sentences.english: an illegal terrorist organization
sentences.chinese: 非法的恐怖组织

sentences.english: international organizations such as the UN
sentences.chinese: 诸如联合国之类的国际组织

detailed_translations.english: a group such as a club or business that has formed for a particular purpose

name: humane
trans: adj. 仁慈的，人道的；高尚的

sentences.english: the campaign for the humane treatment of criminals
sentences.chinese: 提倡人道地对待罪犯的运动

sentences.english: a better, more humane world
sentences.chinese: 更美好、更人道的社会

detailed_translations.english: treating people or animals in a way that is not cruel and causes them as little suffering as possible

name: internship
trans: n. 实习生；（美）实习期；实习医师职位

sentences.english: ...an internship in surgery in New York.
sentences.chinese: …一个在纽约做外科实习的职位。

detailed_translations.english: a job that lasts for a short time, that someone, especially a student, does in order to gain experience

name: proprietary
trans: adj. 专卖的，专营的；所有的，所有权的；（行为）像所有者那样的，所有人（似）的 n. 所有权，所有人

sentences.english: a proprietary brand of insecticide
sentences.chinese: 专利品牌杀虫剂

sentences.english: proprietary software products
sentences.chinese: 专利软件产品

detailed_translations.chinese: 所有的；专利的；私人拥有的
detailed_translations.english: a proprietary product is one that is sold under a  trade name

name: specimen
trans: n. 样品，样本；标本

sentences.english: a blood specimen
sentences.chinese: 血样

detailed_translations.english: a small amount or piece that is taken from something, so that it can be tested or examined
